entity_description: Ancient Egyptian process for preserving a dead body to prevent decay for the afterlife.
resolution_context: The process of mummification involved preserving the body to prevent decay and ensure its preservation for the afterlife. This process typically involved removing the internal organs and drying out the body with salt before wrapping it in linen bandages. Mummification was a central element of Egyptian burial practices aimed at preparing the deceased for the afterlife.

text_span: preserving the body to prevent decay
entity_description: Act of preserving a corpse to prevent decay and maintain it for the afterlife.
resolution_context: The process of mummification involved preserving the body to prevent decay and ensure its preservation for the afterlife. This process typically involved removing the internal organs and drying out the body with salt before wrapping it in linen bandages. Preservation of the body was essential so the soul could be reunited with it in the afterlife.

entity_description: Soft organs inside the body that were removed during mummification.
resolution_context: This process typically involved removing the internal organs and drying out the body with salt before wrapping it in linen bandages. text_span: drying out the body with salt
entity_description: Use of salt to dry out a corpse as part of mummification.
resolution_context: This process typically involved removing the internal organs and drying out the body with salt before wrapping it in linen bandages. The use of salt to desiccate the body was a crucial stage in preventing decay and achieving effective preservation for the afterlife.

entity_description: Strips of linen cloth used to wrap the mummified body.
resolution_context: This process typically involved removing the internal organs and drying out the body with salt before wrapping it in linen bandages. The linen bandages formed the outer covering of the mummy, enclosing the preserved body for burial in the tomb or burial chamber.

entity_description: Ancient Egyptian religious text of spells and prayers placed in tombs to aid the deceased in the afterlife.
resolution_context: One of the most well-known religious texts found in Egyptian tombs is the Book of the Dead. The Book of the Dead was often inscribed on papyrus scrolls and placed in the tomb with the deceased.
